website_summaries.verdict: A large, spacious greenhouse (10' x 26' x 7') that provides ample room for getting a jump start on the growing season.
pros: This greenhouse is constructed using a powder-coated steel frame with a polyethylene film covering
It features a large roll-up door, 12 windows, and 4 ropes with ground stakes for installation
cons: Not as durable as the higher price tag would suggest

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed yet content for my first Greenhouse
customer_reviews.text: The frames are flimsy we used wood around the base for extra security. The plastic is delicate so use caution when assembling. There's only one entrance so you're constantly zipping and unzipping the door. The zippers are plastic and hard to zip and unzip Plus on a few occasions came off track. On a positive note despite the cheaply made product this was my first Greenhouse I made adjustments to help the longevity of the screen house. I do enjoy the spaciousness and the extra windows this provides
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with the cover.
customer_reviews.text: The frame for this greenhouse took a couple hours to put together and the instructions are comprised of just a few pictures. The cover for this greenhouse doesn't have enough velcro strips to secure it to the frame. There are only velcro strips at the front and rear of the 26' span so the wind likes to blow it around. We did buy brick to help hold the cover down but that's not great either. The velcro strip in one corner is already starting to tear the cover and it's only been on the frame for about 2 hours. The strings to tie the door and windows are too short also. I wouldn't purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: First off, the strings it comes with you can't even tighten. About as tough as a well done spaghetti noodle. So you need your own tie down line. The whole thing is actually useless as a matter of fact. Terrible experience. Weak materials.....the lines, poles, everything.....trash. first time the wind blew just a little the thing warped and knocked ALL my beautiful plants into a big pile of broken pots, dirt, and smashed limbs.😞
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: very nice. wish there were vents in the top though ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice. wish there were vents in the top though when its about 80 degrees out in the greenhouse with all the doors open and all vents open it is about 120 degrees. although when it was colder in the freezing temps it did not freeze in the greenhouse it was just warm enough that my plants did not die. this of course with all the doors and vents shut. only real negative is the ends of the bars were already rusting and the directions not vary easy to read but other than that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sissy Jean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Such an easy set up, light and insulated. We customized this greenhouse, adding two more window for more airflow. But because of the lightweight materials there is also a chance to bend the bars during setup and windy days. We used rocks for extra weight. The tarp is also a lot more durable than we thought, but due to bending the poles it didn't fit perfectly. This is the perfect green house for beginners looking to customize their garden.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 6 months falls apart!!!
customer_reviews.text: Please be careful this product holds up for about 6 months and the plastics starts to break and fall apart not worth the buy!!! And I received it torn contacted company they wanted pictures frame is sturdy and fairly good k but the outer shells is really cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Suprised it was pretty well made
customer_reviews.text: Suprised it was pretty well made. The windows have not stood up to the wind but they would be open anyway. In a big wind storm the frame bent in half, but was easily straightened out. We will put rope and t posts to keep the top from whipping in the wind. I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for?
customer_reviews.text: Majorly inferior product. Cannot withstand wind. Rips and bends, poles are to weak and anchors bend. Built with the lowest of quality in mind. I'm two for two with these failing. Can't beat the price though!
customer_reviews.author: Whittany D.

customer_reviews.title: The fabric falls apart
customer_reviews.text: After only a couple of months the fabric fell apart as the plastic coating crumbled in the sun. While the frame is a little light, it is not truly a problem. But without a cover, the greenhouse is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good thing for a greenhouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought one, cover lasted less than 6 months due to sun exposure. Not a good thing for a greenhouse. Can't find a replacement cover.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Rushing

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price that I used the project for
customer_reviews.text: Missed one bolt and nut, but I wasn't sure if I lost them myself. Works great for the price that I used the project for, but deffinatly have to make some modifications to fit my project. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Iiona

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Best thing I’ve ever purchased off Amazon yet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about four+ years ago and it is still holding strong. Had to replace the plastic cover after one season but well worth the price and speedy shipping. Great product. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: genyphfur

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: got it put together canopy wont fit right fit well had light showers the next day the whole dam thing caved in on itself its very poorly made dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: linda campbell

customer_reviews.title: Don't over torque the hex head bolts. The heads will stripe out.
customer_reviews.text: Delivery of your product was as stated. Assembled pretty easy with two people. I used a cordless drill so it cut down on assembly time. It took about two and a half hours. Not bad. I would have liked to seen more tie downs in the middle. And the hold down spikes are to short and flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cox

customer_reviews.title: didnt seem to fit description
customer_reviews.text: frame work was much chinsier than appeared or described, the cover seems OK
customer_reviews.author: Mudslinger

customer_reviews.title: This is clearly a temporary greenhouse at a compelling price ...
customer_reviews.text: This is clearly a temporary greenhouse at a compelling price for it's size. If you need something more robust you should consider greenhouses at a higher price point.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A Ross

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend them.
customer_reviews.text: We have bought 3 of the outsunny 26 x 10 they are all incomplete some are missing tubes and cloths and others are missing manual instructions and tubes. Avoid yourself some headaches! I would not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: M M

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Cover rips easy after being in the sun for Less then a week, frame got bent in light wind, so only buy if your willing to reinforce it and buy a better cover
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: A very sturdy greenhouse and was exactly as i wanted.
customer_reviews.author: myhero84

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a great price gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Fatima Joseph

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bought one last fall. By January it was a pile of bent tubing and torn covering.
customer_reviews.author: mack w.

customer_reviews.title: Good greee house for gardening, Bad for people with HOAs
customer_reviews.text: this seems to be very well made and was the perfect dimensions to cover my wife's 2 raised bed garden. I bought more with the thought of having something that would keep our dog and cat out of the gardens and something for my wife to continue her gardening in the winter. However, my wife was afraid this would get our HOA after us and therefore did not keep it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got on time. But was missing hardware kit and no instructions
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Trys to blow away in the wind bet so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Shawn Scott

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up. The directions were very vague, but the whole thing was easy enough to figure out. The plastic is a lot thicker than I expected it to be. The tubing is not flimsy like I thought would be. Over all a surprisingly great product and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Confidential

customer_reviews.title: horrible product
customer_reviews.text: really diffilcult to put together. the directions are not intelligeble. Not 7 feet tall, in fact it is 6 feet tall. do yourself a favor and go with the quictent
customer_reviews.author: trent

customer_reviews.title: Does the job......with help.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these 2 years ago. I live in the upper midwest,wind and heavy snow are common here. I reinforced the frame and added come pvc supports to the roof. Anchored it with rebar stakes and covered the exterior with a second layer of 12 mil plastic and some heavy gauge wire fencing. This helped hold in heat during cold snaps as well as protected it from high winds. Now, the zippers are s***. I framed a door on mine. For a budget greenhouse, if you take some added measures to ensure the stability. It suffices. Still cheaper with my add ons than most others in its class.
customer_reviews.author: stb

customer_reviews.title: Structure is cheap and bends easy, the ties you use to secure the plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: Structure is cheap and bends easy, the ties you use to secure the plastic sheet to the structure easily rips off, did not survive the first strong wind, the center collapsed and destroyed the cheap, thin frame, I made something myself and used the sheeting on it, plastic lasted for 6 months. If you really want to lose your money and get pissed off please purchase this item. Please Note: Only reason I put 1 Star is because they did not have a - 1,000,000
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. CHEAP, FLIMSY, OVERPRICED.
customer_reviews.text: greenhouse literaly did not last 10 mins before frame bent to a point of not being usable. you are better off building it out of pvc.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: The frame is fine but had to spend another $215 to replace the ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not last one season before the plastic started to come apart and fall down inside. The frame is fine but had to spend another $215 to replace the plastic from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Texas

product_meta.title: Outsunny 26' x 10' x 7' Portable Walk-in Garden Greenhouse - Deep Green
